intro: Clavija weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's clavija, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs. Clavija weberbaueri is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky slopes.
